timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: Same for other occurrences in this file
replies.author: pabloem

timeline.bodyText: Same as Python - will this timeout first, or fail immediately?
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText:
As discussed on the python PR. It shouldn't resolve the address and return much faster than the timeout.
If it does resolve for some reason (as you suggested running on a GCE VM+setting the metadata, but not via Dataflow), I still validate the returned job_id string is a valid cloud label before attaching it as a bq job label.
replies.author: ajamato

timeline.bodyText: An intersting example: What if the worker running this code is a GCE VM, but not on Dataflow (e.g. Dataproc, DirectRunner on GCE VM)? Will that case be handled properly? This should be exercised by postcommits, I'd think...
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: If a valid cloud label string is provided job_id is defined in the metadata, it will be pulled in and added a s a beam_job_id label to the BQ jobs. Shouldn't break anything, and if the job_id is meaningful it could be quite useful. It would actually be a good thing to do intentionally, IMO. Might be worth suggesting to dataproc.
replies.author: ajamato
